title: The Hidden Link Between Prince Andrew and Jeffrey Epstein
summary: This article investigates David Stern, a German businessman who served as a key intermediary between Prince Andrew and Jeffrey Epstein. In spring 2019, Stern attended a gala dinner in Shenzhen, China, for Pitch@Palace, a start-up competition associated with Prince Andrew. This event occurred shortly before Prince Andrew stepped back from royal duties due to controversy over his ties to Epstein, a convicted sex offender. Recent releases of documents by the U.S. Department of Justice reveal Stern's extensive role: he facilitated introductions, managed deals, assisted with Sarah Ferguson's debts, and made derogatory remarks about women. Based in London, Stern ran his own business and referred to Epstein as boss, while also holding positions in royal circles, such as director of Pitch@Palace and board member of St George's House charity. Despite his low public profile, Stern's name appears in over 7,000 documents from 2008 to 2018, highlighting his behind-the-scenes influence. The article uses these emails to illustrate how Stern operated discreetly, emphasizing the complex networks that can exist among influential figures.

background_read: This article delves into the connections between Prince Andrew, a British royal, and Jeffrey Epstein, a financier convicted of sex offenses. David Stern emerges as a central figure, using his business acumen to bridge these worlds. The context includes the release of millions of pages by the U.S. Department of Justice, part of ongoing investigations into Epstein's network. Pitch@Palace, founded by Prince Andrew, aimed to support entrepreneurs but became entangled in scandal. Stern's involvement highlights how individuals can operate in elite circles while maintaining secrecy. Understanding this requires knowledge of royal institutions, legal processes, and the impact of document leaks on public perception of power dynamics.
